CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 26, 1951, pg. 27 reads: "R.L. Vann School Play - Pupils of Vann School presented the play, "Puck Drops In," Tuesday in school auditorium.  The amateur actors and the parts they played included Nellie Coleman as the prologue; Verdine Staton as Mary Jean; Eleanor Crawford as Betty Lou; Jerome Ellis as Puck, Edward Own as Punch; Dolores Taylor as Judy; Roy Grayso nas [sic] Clown; Elizabeth Sharpe as drum major; Melvin Russell as a sailor; Ella Battles as the white rabbit; Vernon Jerry as Red Feather, and Charles Evins as aviator. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Punch and Judy play cast, from left: Charles Evins, Melvin Russell, Vernon Jerry, Elizabeth Sharpe, Edward Own, Dolores Taylor, Jerome Ellis, Roy Grayson, unknown, possibly Verdine Staton or Eleanor Crawford, and Ella Battles wearing rabbit costume, gathered on stage for "Puck Drops In," Robert L. Vann Elementary School
